title: Quiz 6: Common Conditions & Community Health
topicName: Unit 1: Mental Health and Psychiatric Nursing
description: Covering schizophrenia, mood disorders, substance abuse, childhood disorders, and community mental health.

questions.question: Which type of Schizophrenia is characterized by a stuporous state, mutism, and waxy flexibility?
questions.explanation: Catatonic schizophrenia involves immobility (stupor) or excessive activity.

questions.question: Match the level of prevention to its activity:
questions.explanation: Primary = prevent occurrence; Secondary = early treat; Tertiary = rehab.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ is defined as significantly sub-average general intellectual functioning appearing before age 17, while ___BLANK___ is a decline in mental functioning often occurring in old age.
questions.explanation: Mental retardation is developmental; Dementia is degenerative.
questions.hint: One is developmental, the other affects the elderly.

questions.question: Which of the following are essential elements of comprehensive mental health services according to the Community Mental Act? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The Act mandated in-patient, out-patient, emergency, partial hospitalization, and consultation services.
questions.hint: Think of the basic needs for community care.

questions.question: What is the drug of choice for alcohol detoxification to manage withdrawal symptoms?
questions.explanation: Chlordiazepoxide (Librium) is the standard benzodiazepine for alcohol detox.

questions.question: ADHD is more common in girls than in boys.
questions.explanation: ADHD occurs more in boys than girls (ratio 9:1).

questions.question: Order the stages of alcohol detoxification treatment:
questions.explanation: Dose tapers down over the week.

questions.question: Which disorder involves the repeated exposure of genitals to strangers for sexual excitement?
questions.explanation: Exhibitionism is the exposure of genitals.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristic symptoms of Panic Disorder? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Panic attacks involve tachycardia (fast heart), not slow heart rate.
questions.hint: Think of a 'fight or flight' response.

questions.question: What vitamin is administered to alcoholics to prevent Wernicke-Korsakoff syndrome?
questions.explanation: Thiamine (Vitamin B1) prevents neurological damage in alcoholics.
